data.title: Crashes at launch when process.env.APPDATA is not set.
data.body:
- VSCode Version:  1.4.0
- OS Version:  Windows 7 Prof. SP1 64-bit

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/494060/17737810/b6100414-645c-11e6-84e4-32f65eabbdf4.png)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch from user profile where APPDATA is missing

data.title: Extension recommendations do not include an immediate way to install them

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.3.1 (e6b4afa53e9c0f54edef1673de9001e9f0f547ae, 2016-07-12T13:35:06.227Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601

When I receive a recommendation, such as one to install a special c-sharp helper extension, why do you tease me with just the recommendation and no _DIRECT_ way to immediately install that recommended extension?

Why not include "Would you like to install this/these recommendation(s) now?" as part of the recommendation?  Don't just tease me.  Make it easy to follow through on the recommendation.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open up a single file with a .cs extension.
2. Look on in wonderment at the recommendation to install a special c-sharp helper extension with nothing on the screen to provide an IMMEDIATE, DIRECT way to install that recommended extension.

data.title: Use IEnvironmentService everywhere
When I hit a breakpoint vscode opens a new readonly version of the file, breakpoints not shown in gutter
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0 - it didn't happen in older versions.
- OS Version: windows 10

Whenever I hit a breakpoint, vscode halts on a new "tab" with a readonly version of the file with the full path instead of the local path, and sometimes doesn't display all the breakpoints I've set.

Does this happen to anyone else?

Example images:
![before_hitting_breakpoint](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/963221/17734403/add0491c-6484-11e6-9ea3-9445a2f9b3c5.png)
![after_hitting_breakpoint](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/963221/17734404/add15e2e-6484-11e6-959e-e1847a85fed4.png)

Steps to Reproduce:
Not sure - I tried it in a new project and couldn't reproduce.
In my project it's as simple as hitting a breakpoint on a function.

data.title: Feature request : remember the state of the workspace

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0 
- OS Version: OS X 10.11

When i relaunch VS Code, my tabs are kept, it's what i want. 
But the view "Output" is showed again while i decided to hide it before i quit. 
Same thing for the breakline, it's systematically on when i launch VS Code.

It's only two examples but I would appreciate if my workspace is in the same state than when i quit previously.

data.title: Get telemetry when extension editor opens
Request to enable font customization for other non-editor window
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0-insider (2016-07-22T05:07:03.113Z)
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:
1. File -> Preferences -> User Settings/Workspace Settings

The default font for the Explorer/Search/Git/Debug/etc pane and other windows like Debug/Console/etc are not optimal for screen with not so big screen and using a split window.  Those other windows takes too much spaces when using it.

I'd like to request per subject to independently have a way to customize the font sizes for all those non-editor window.  Example...

``` properties
# current way to change the editor window font size
"editor.fontSize": 14,
# other non-editor font settings
"global.other.editor.fontSize": 12,
# or maybe per individual panel/window settings... although this may be too much
"window.debug.fontSize": 12,
"window.console.fontSize": 12,
```

data.title: typescript format code broken
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.5.0.insider latest - OS Version: OSX El Capitan With the latest vscode insider, the format code is broken for typescript files. If i use the official build it works correctly. The second screenshot shows how classes are indented (variables are put on the same line).

data.title: git annotate feature

data.title: Create an extension with simple icons support
data.body:
Using attached set: 
[Simple.Explorer.Icons.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/421766/Simple.Explorer.Icons.zip)

Looking at vscode-icons, they
- set a CSS class in the form of `<language-id>-file-icon` on the file label (e.g. `dockerfile-file-icon`)
- set a CSS class of `default-file-icon` if the language ID cannot be resolved
- override some CSS for the case of `folder-icon` to show a folder icon and also add some CSS for when the parent row is expanded to support the expanded folder icon. maybe we want to make this more explicit and introduce `expanded-folder-icon` and `collapsed-folder-icon`?
- when showing an icon, the CSS properties to show it are `padding-left: 22px;` and `background-size: 16px !important;`. we could make this a convention and ask our icon providers to provide good versions for 16px dimensions. this would work for SVG and PNG. 
- we need to account for light, dark and hc theme

data.title: Uri to jump to a specific line in file
data.body:
Hi, 
Currently I am writing an extension that will output a file path and line number to an OutputChannel. Something like this:

> From file: [c:\code.java]() Line 64

vscode turns the file path into a link leading to a file and that is nice. However, I wonder if there is a way to combine the "Line 64" part too. Something like:

> From file: [c:\code.java:line=64]()

Clicking this link will open the **code.java** file and move the cursor to the start of **line 64**.

data.title: Single File IntelliSense not working on new file
data.body:
WORKING ON THE SPECIFIC STEPS HERE... CLOSE TO IDENTIFYING THE EXACT STEPS 
- VSCode Version: 1.5.0-Insider 11ffcfcf69608c07e7db4b4c77856854d5083497
  (Also observed on Stable)
- OS Version: 10.11.1

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open an empty directory
2. Create a new JavaScript file `test.js` through File -> New File (note this will not reproduce when clicking the new file icon). 
3. Write the following code. 

```
var x = {
    a: 1, 
    b: 2
}

x.
```

I expect to see IntelliSense. 

Instead I see. Loading does not resolve. 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2449568/17720782/89bae5a6-63d9-11e6-8784-e25aab88a739.png)
1. Reload JavaScript Project, Reload Window, close and open the file, or restart VS Code. 

RIGHT NOW SOMETIMES IT WILL WORK IF YOU CLOSE AND OPEN THE FILE, SOMETIMES NOT. TRYING TO NARROW IT DOWN. 

```
➜  vscode-intellisense git:(master) ✗ tsc --version
Version 1.9.0-dev.20160130
```

I have repeated this twice and confirmed it with @ramya-rao-a. 

Possibly what I was seeing in this issue - https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/9913

data.title: [Debug] Failure returned for configurationDone is not displayed in UI
data.body:
- VSCode Version: all
- OS Version: all

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a debug adapter that sets the `supportsConfigurationDoneRequest` flag to true in initialize.
2. Have the `configurationDone` handler return a failure with an error message.

Expected:
VSCode ends the debug session (by sending a `disconnect` request) and displays the error message.

Actual:
VSCode swallows the failure and the (failed) debug session continues.

@isidorn @weinand @jacdavis

data.title: tasks.json showOutput IntelliSense shows silent as the default
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.4.0
- OS Version:Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Hover over tasks.json showOutput variable. Text says "...If omitted, 'always' is used."
2. Now show suggestions for showOutput and down arrow to 'silent'. "Default value" is shown.

I believe the default is 'always'.

data.title: Unresponsive when expanding a folder with a lot of files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Clone the [Microsoft/Typescript](https://github.com/Microsoft/typescript) project
2.  In the explorer expand the tests/baselines folder

Code will stop responding. There are a lot of files in it's child folder so it's unreasonable to expect it to list them immediately but having it freeze doesn't feel like the best user experience either.

data.title: Signature Help shows only 2 lines of the method's comments
data.body:
Signature Help shows only 2 lines of the method's comments. Auto-complete shows a single truncated line with ellipsis and an option to expand to see the whole text. Signature Help should also have a similar feature. This happens to all extensions that implement the `SignatureHelpProvider`

data.title: New VS Code Install Causes CreateProcess Failed Error Code 216
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4
- OS Version: Windows 7 Professional (Service Pack 1) 64-bit

data.title: Adopt service library for all IPC communication main <=> renderer

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
**Requests: Renderer → Main**

- [x] `vscode:openFilePicker`
- [x] `vscode:openFolderPicker`
- [x] `vscode:openFileFolderPicker`
- [x] `vscode:reloadWindow`
- [x] `vscode:toggleDevTools`
- [x] `vscode:windowOpen`, to open windows
- [x] `vscode:closeFolder`
- [x] `vscode:openNewWindow`
- [x] `vscode:toggleFullScreen`
- [x] `vscode:setFullScreen`
- [x] `vscode:openDevTools`
- [x] `vscode:setRepresentedFilename`
- [x] `vscode:setMenuBarVisibility`
- [x] `vscode:flashFrame`
- [x] `vscode:openRecent` → `getRecentlyOpened`
- [x] `vscode:focusWindow`
- [x] `vscode:showWindow`
- [x] `vscode:switchWindow`, has a result
- [x] `vscode:setDocumentEdited`
- [x] `vscode:toggleMenuBar`
- [x] `vscode:setHeaders`, we could remove this now that the gallery service doesn't depend on the telemetry service for the extra headers
- [x] `vscode:log`
- [x] `vscode:closeExtensionHostWindow`
- [x] `vscode:showItemInFolder`
- [x] `vscode:openExternal`
- [x] `vscode:startCrashReporter`

**Requests: Main → Renderer**

- [ ] `vscode:resolveKeybindings`, `vscode:keybindingsResolved`, done at startup to any one renderer
- [ ] `vscode:beforeUnload`, `vscode:ok`, `vscode:cancel`, done at shutdown to all renderers
- [ ] `vscode:runAction`
- [ ] `vscode:telemetry`
- [ ] `vscode:reportError`
- [ ] `vscode:openFiles`
- [ ] `vscode:showInfoMessage`
- [ ] `vscode.toggleAutoSave`
- [ ] `vscode:enterFullScreen`
- [ ] `vscode:leaveFullScreen`

**Events: Renderer → Main**

- [ ] `vscode:exit`
- [ ] `vscode:workbenchLoaded`

**Others**

- [ ] `broadcast`, renderer → main, main → renderer. Used to broadcast messages among all renderers. We should look into each of the use cases and fix them semantically:
  - [ ] `ICON_THEME_CHANNEL`
  - [ ] `COLOR_THEME_CHANNEL`
  - [ ] `EXTENSION_ATTACH_BROADCAST_CHANNEL`
  - [ ] `EXTENSION_LOG_BROADCAST_CHANNEL`
  - [ ] `EXTENSION_TERMINATE_BROADCAST_CHANNEL`
- [x] `vscode:update*`, renderer ↔ main
- [x] `_workbench.ipc` command
  - [x] `vscode:openFolderPicker`
  - [x] `vscode:windowOpen`
